comments: abs(a(n)) is the number of cycles in all permutations of n elements with an even number of cycles. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 06 2007
formula: E.g.f.: (1+x)*x/2*U(0)  where U(k)= 1 - 1/((1+x)^2 - x*(1+x)^4*(k+1)/(x*(1+x)^2*(k+1) + (k+2)/U(k+1))) ; (continued fraction, 3rd kind, 3-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 25 2012a(n) ~ n! * (-1)^n * log(n) / 2 * (1 + gamma/log(n)), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant (A001620). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 24 2015
example: a(n) = ((-1)^n*(n!*h(n)+(n-2)!))/2, n>1, where h(n)= sum(k=1..n, 1/k ). [From Gary Detlefs, Aug 31 2011]
mathematica: nn=30; Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Sinh[Log[1 + x]]*Log[1 + x], {x, 0, nn}], x]CoefficientList[Series[(x*(2 + x)*Log[1 + x])/(2*(1 + x)), {x, 0, 20}], x] * Range[0, 20]! (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 24 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) x='x+O('x^66) /* that many terms */Vec(serlaplace(sinh(log(1+x))*log(1+x))) /* show terms, starting from a(2) */
author: _R. H. Hardin_
